document.title: W205-Controlling Winter Annual Broadleaf Weeds

author.organization: The University of Tennessee Agricultural Extension Service

document.abstract: Maintaining a vigorous turfgrass stand will protect against weed infestation. However, during the winter months turfgrasses are not actively growing and are therefore susceptible to the encroachment of winter annual broadleaf weeds. Controlling winter annual broadleaf weeds before they are able to set seed will not only reduce the likelihood of an outbreak the following year, but improve the aesthetic quality of the turfgrass stand.
